intro: Arthrosolen phaeotrichus, commonly known as the dark-haired rock moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green to blackish foliage. The plant typically grows on shaded, moist rock surfaces in temperate regions. Its leaves are closely appressed and have a distinctive, slightly curled margin. Arthrosolen phaeotrichus is often found in humid, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
